answers.answer: Tingling sensations in the feet and hands is also a symptom of diabetes.I'd go to a doctor and get bloodwork done very soon, and for a week maybe wear comfortable, supportive shoes with no heels.Best wishes.
I get tingleing toes to! Its wierd isn't it

question: Hi,for the last 3 days my toes have been tingling like pins in needles n i'm getting a bit concerned!  I've been looking at possible reasons on t internet n I've been told by my doctor before that I have poor circulation but nothing to be concerned about,and also the tingling was triggered by me wearing very high and tight shoes all day and night.  These have both been cited as possible reasons, I'm not in any pain at all n it's more apparent when I'm lying down, is it normal that its been constant for 3 days?  Do I need to see a doctor or how long should I wait before I do?
title: Tingling toes
